titleStmt.title: John Butcher to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2068

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
41 Nassau Street
New York City
March 25, 1865
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of the State of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky
Sir

I would respectfully ask to be appointed Commissioner of Deeds &c for Keny I have practised as a Commissioner for the majority of the State for some years and would like to have Ky on my list Should you desire testimonials as to my capability &c I shall be glad to do it Trusting you will grant my humble request

I have the honor to be
Sir
Yours most respectfully
John Butcher

Comr Deeds for New York
John Butcher
appt & comd
31st Mch/65
